Institution.Regional_Research_Technology_Transfer_St: Semiliguda, Post Box No: 10, Sunabeda, Koraput -763002

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Chances of clear to mainly clear to generally cloudy sky during next five days. Chances of no rainfall during next five days. Maximum temperature is expected to be 32-33°C and minimum temperature is expected to be 18-21°C.

Agromet_Advisory.General: No rainfall and dry weather expected during next five days. So, go for irrigation in crop field as per requirement. Farmers are advised for not to burn the residue of kharif crops in the fields because it not only pollute the environment but also causes severe health problems.

Rice.Advisory: Apply light irrigation to the nursery beds twice a week. The rice seedlings at 4 -5 leaf stage are ready for transplanting. Blast in rice nursery may observe, to control it spray the nursery area with Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 0.4 g/litre of water. For transplanted rice apply 4.5 kg urea, 44 kg DAP and 22 kg MoP per acre as basal dose during final puddling.

Maize.Advisory: Fall army worm may observe in rabi maize field, to control it spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/litre of water. Complete the sowing of summer maize within 1st week of February at a spacing of 60 cm x 20 cm with seed rate of 6 kg/acre. Apply of 52 kg DAP and 40 kg MoP per acre as basal dose. To control weeds spray Atrazine 50% WP @ 800 g/acre with 200 litres of water within 3 days after sowing.

Groundnut.Advisory: Chances of tobacco caterpillar infestation in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2 ml/litre of water. Collar rot and stem rot may observe in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64%WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water to the base of the plant. Go for land preparation and sowing of summer groundnut at a spacing of 25 cm x 10 cm with seed rate of 50 kg/acre. Apply 35 kg DAP, 4 kg urea and 27 kg MoP per acre along with 10 kg zinc sulfate and 4 kg borax/acre as basal. Before sowing seed should be treated with 10 g Trichoderma harzianum/viride or 3 g Carboxin 37.5% + Thiram 37.5% DS for one kg seed.

Mustard/Toria.Advisory: Chances of aphid infestation, if observe spray Dimethoate 30% EC @ 1.5 ml/litre of water or Imidacloprid 17.8 % SL @ 0.3 ml/litre of water.

Cauliflower.Advisory: Chances of diamond back moth infestation in cauliflower, if observe spray Azadirachtin 5% W/W @ 0.5 ml/litre of water or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.

Brinjal.Advisory: Shoot and fruit borer may reported in brinjal field, to control it spray spray Azadirachtin 1% EC @ 3 ml/litre of water or Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.

Tomato.Advisory: Chances of infestation of sucking pests like white fly and aphid in tomato, to control these spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 9.5 ZC @ 3.75 ml or Azadirachtin 5% EC @ 7.5 ml in 15 litre of water.

Okra.Advisory: To control fruit borer in okra spray neem based pesticide 300 ppm @ 5ml/litre of water. At later stages spray of Spinosad 45% SC @ 0.4ml/litre of water.

Chilli.Advisory: Fruit rot infestation may observe in field, if observe spray Azoxystrobin 23% SC @ 1 ml/litre of water or Tebuconazole 25.9% EC @ 1 ml/litre of water.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits &Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio -Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements
